newsitem.title: CHINA: Tongyang Securities opens office in Shanghai.
newsitem.headline: Tongyang Securities opens office in Shanghai.

text.p: South Korea's Tongyang Securities has opened a representative office in Shanghai to become the sixth South Korean securities firm to have such an office in the city, the Shanghai Securities News said on Sunday.
The newspaper quoted a company official as saying that the office would be the focus for the firm's China business and would probably develop into the centre of its Asia business.
Tongyang Securities had so far this year participated in underwriting four foreign currency B share issues in China, the newspaper said.
The newspaper said by the end of 1995, the securities firm had total assests of $1.3 billion with 29 branches in South Korea and counterparts in New York, London, Tokyo and Hong Kong.
